column1: The Great Barrier Reef is one of the most biodiverse ecosystems on Earth. It stretches over 2,300 kilometers off the coast of Australia and is home to thousands of species of marine life, including colorful coral reefs, sharks, and turtles. Many tourists visit the reef each year to snorkel and dive among its vibrant underwater landscapes.
column2: Which statement about the Great Barrier Reef is true?
column3: A) It is located off the coast of Africa
column4: B) It is a small ecosystem with limited marine life
column5: C) Thousands of species of marine life inhabit the reef
column6: D) Tourists visit the reef to see polar bear

column1: The Great Barrier Reef is one of the most spectacular natural wonders of the world, stretching over 2,300 kilometers along the northeast coast of Australia. It is renowned for its vibrant coral formations and diverse marine life.
column2: What is the Great Barrier Reef famous for?
column5: c) Its vibrant coral formations and marine life.
